Entries.DialogueText: Please keep my location a secret. If the dwarves knew of me, they'd surely send an assassin.
I try not to make too much noise down here. Imagine if the townspeople heard my weird sounds coming from the sewer drain...
...Have you encountered others like me, in the mines? I'm sorry if they were hostile towards you. You see, we've learned to fear humans... there have been too many... unpleasant encounters.
You haven't... slain any of my friends, have you?
A 1000 year war between my people and the dwarves recently ended. There's still a lot of resentment on both sides.
Oh... is this what you call a 'birthday present'? I don't understand humans...
Oh, a gift to remember the day that I hatched! Thank you!
This smells delicious! I'll eat half, and use the other half to moisturize my body...
A gift of lovely perfume? Oh, ... I'm blushing, but you probably can't notice...
Hey, look! All my friends are in here!
Wait a minute, is that me...?
Is that Stardrop Tea? Thank you! One drop makes my room smell good for the whole day.
...I'm a little bruised, but I'm okay.
The flow of water has been unusually strong today... what's going on up there?
Please, don't be alarmed. I am different than the others.
I've spent a lot of time observing humans. I know you like to shop. Care to see my wares?
Back again? I suppose it does fit into my theory of human behavior.
'Krobus' means 'bridge-crosser' in our language.
Oh, it's an arctic shard! That's a very rare magical item.
I'd bring that to the Wizard if I were you!
On Fridays I stay silent as a sign of devotion to Yoba.
I'd love to see more of the outside world, but it wouldn't be safe for me.
I'll never know what it's like to be human... but talking to you, I feel like I understand it a little.
I wanted to give you this as a 'thank you' for letting me live here with you.
...Sorry, I'm still a little wary of humans. My shop is still open to you, however.
You're not like the other humans, are you?
You've opened my eyes to the world of humans. I appreciate that.
Please don't tell anyone about me.
Humans tend to destroy things they can't understand.
Most humans are frightened by us shadow people... maybe for good reason.
But regardless, if the townspeople knew about me, I might not be safe here.
I am too sensitive to sunlight to go out on most days.
The conditions in here are perfect.
Care to buy anything?
I find things here and I sell them. Care to buy anything?
If you put your ear up to the right pipe, you can hear into any house from down here.
I wouldn't eavesdrop, though!
... I'm afraid we'll have to keep this a secret... Neither my people nor yours would accept us living together.
You know I'll be a very strange person to live with, right? I won't be able to leave the house...
If you dwarves hadn't driven us from our ancestral home, we'd never have had to resort to violence!
I'm sorry about your family.
Come and get it, shrimpy.
...And I'm truly sorry about the past, Dwarf. I have no personal gripe with you.
Wh-what are you doing here?
This is an amazing gift. For my people it is a great honor to receive something like this.
Thank you very much.
Humans have... interesting tastes.
Oh... Um. I guess I'll accept it.
Thank you.
